summary: SideEffect callable's return type is not being respected; values are cast to string instead of the declared return type. The user expects a UuidInterface to be returned but receives a string.
userImpact: Developers lose type safety when using SideEffect with callables, requiring manual type casting instead of automatic type preservation based on callable return type.
rootCause: SideEffect implementation does not inspect the callable's return type annotation to properly cast the returned value.
proposedFix: Implement return type inspection on the callable to automatically cast the side effect result to the declared return type.
resolutionDetails: The SideEffect implementation was updated to respect callable return type declarations and cast returned values accordingly.
keyQuote: In this code `$newUuid` should contain `UuidInterface` value, not string
